The period for which the funds will be available once notice has been given. This field defines the number of days, months or working days for which funds subject to notice conditions will be available. e.g. if three months notice is given for withdrawal then the bank can stipulate that the funds will only be available for two weeks after which a further three months notice must be given.
Validation Rules
2-3 alphanumeric characters in the format: nnD, nnM or nnW.
Defines the notice, in days or months, which must be given before the amount, specified in NOTICE.AMOUNT can be withdrawn.
The number of days, months or working days which constitute the period. e.g. 20D, 7W, 3M, etc.
Validation Rules
3 alphanumeric characters - nnD, nnM or nnW format.

Defines named values to indicate if an option applies to the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE. More than one option can be associated with the NR.ATTRIBUTE, with certain restrictions.
Validation Rules
Valid Inputs are NEGOTIABLE, NON-NEGOTIABLE, OVERRIDE, FIX-VALUE, MANDATORY as described below: -
NEGOTIABLE
The value of NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE can be negotiated at the arrangement level.
NON-NEGOTIABLE
The value of NON-NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE cannot be negotiated at the arrangement level. Both NEGOTIABLE and NON-NEGOTIABLE cannot be defined together
OVERRIDE
Specifies if a default override message should be generated if the default attribute is amended at the arrangement level. If OVERRIDE is not specified, no override will be generated.
FIX-VALUE
Specified if the field value is to be fixed at the arrangement level. If FIX-VALUE is not specified the field value will vary with the changes to the underlying product condition.
MANDATORY
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory for this product condition. Can only be specified where the attribute is not defined as mandatory in the property class.
It is possible to define negotiation rules in EB.COMPARISON.TYPE.

Input must be a valid record from EB.STANDARD.COMPARISON

Identifies the options available for building the available balance on an account. The unauthorised movement fields will be updated but may not necessarily be used for balance checking. This is to enable a new type of balance check to be made if the parameter settings are changed.It can be set at Arrangement level (AA.ARR.BALANCE.AVAILABILITY) or at the Product Level (AA.PRD.DES.BALANCE.AVAILABILITY) or ACCOUNT.PARAMETER level.
Unauthorised debits or Unauthorised credits , or both or none of them
It will be selected in the following order:
1. Arrangement (AA.ARR.BALANCE.AVAILABILITY)
2. ACCOUNT.PARAMETER, if not set at Arrangement level
Validation Rules
BOTH - Unauthorised debits and credits to be included in the available balance
NONE - No unauthorised movements to be included in the available balance
DEBITS - Only unauthorised debits to make up available balance
CREDITS - Only unauthorised credits to make up available balance
The default will be No authorised movements to be included in the available balance

Identifies on which balance, overdraft and limit checking should be made. It can be set at Arrangement level (AA.ARR.BALANCE.AVAILABILITY) or at the Product Level (AA.PRD.DES.BALANCE.AVAILABILITY) or ACCOUNT.PARAMETER level.
The flag will be selected in the following order:
1. Arrangement
2. ACCOUNT.PARAMETER, if not set at Arrangement level
Validation Rules
AVAILABLE:
Credit checking is made using AVAILABLE.BAL
WORKING:
Credit checking is made using WORKING.BALANCE
FORWARD:
Credit checking is made using WORKING.BALANCE plus today's forward movements.
AVAILWORK:
Credit checking is made using AVAILABLE.BAL and WORKING.BALANCE.
AVAILFWD:
Credit checking is made using AVAILABLE.BAL and WORKING.BALANCE plus today's forward movements.
BLANK: The default checking is against WORKING.BALANCE
Optional field - Allowed Values are RESETTING and NON-RESETTING.
RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities (for eg : change.product, rollover or reset) the property conditions will be reset from the product.
NON-RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities property conditions will be maintained from the Arrangement level.
Leaving the field blank sets NON-RESETTING as the default option.
Not used in Arrangement/Sim level.
